column4: Shouldn't it be possible to make a folder in /mnt/ without sudo/root?
I'll check if I can make folders in mount without sudo.
I can make folders on my harddrive without sudo and I need to make them without sudo.
where were you trying to make them?
You can make folders but I questioned where you wanted to make them
dator@dator:/mnt/harddrive2$ mkdir test // mkdir: cannot create directory `test': Permission denied
And when I can't make folders without sudo, I can't transfer files over the LAN without using root.
I am tired and about to call it a night.  What format was the mounted drive
What package did you use to install ice and how hard was it?
And can you switch between that and gnome?
I used sudo apt-get install icewm. I install fileroller too, but it's horrible.
I think I can switch too FVWM, Fluxbox, but I'm not sure what happens with program using X.
One last question how do you run ice once it is installed
, Then I logged in with gdm, I changed session from Xubuntu too IceWM and choose to use it as default.
